>What is it?
https://www.pokeclicker.com/
Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

>Crobat?
https://crobat4.github.io/pokeclicker/
A modified version of Pokeclicker that features QoL changes from the original, including a Dock shortcut, type-based pokeball selection, Gen 3+ berries being available in dungeons, un-nerfed experience gains, and some egg-exclusive pokemon being available through other means.

>Wiki
https://pokeclicker.miraheze.org/wiki/Home_Page

>CODES
Start Menu > Save > Enter Code
>OOOSHINY
Free shiny
>FARMINGBOOST
10,000 Farm Points and 100 Cheri Berries
>CROBATISBASED (Crobat fork only)
Awards a Rotom (Crobat)

>Encounter tables, best places to gem/EV farm
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IxPh59_lNxZUa3Qo3r5ZbawGHL_nfqqd
>Various forecasts
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1HFK5gS4XDmqXvZPP8stBYGC9ZF77i-Wug2J_gcmJ5rw

>>52774226
Baffling to me an open source browser game in 2022 won't even allow discussion of modding while real games include mod suppport, encourage modding, or even integrate mods into their games as features. Beyond being silly, they're killing off the scriptDev-to-gameDev pipeline. You've got a niche group of people who know how to code, have spent time getting familiar with the game's code, and are invested enough in the game to write for it. They're low hanging fruit for recruitment, but if they drop into the Discord they'll find that even discussing scripts is enough to get you branded by a condescending mod. It's not just a few people either: the main script github repository has 238 forks and 144 stars compared to 247 forks and 391 stars on the games actual repo. That's a lot of developer investment to spit in the face of.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52784654
Part of what made the legendary birds so cool was context.
They were out of the way (first 2 were, at least) and rewarded you for exploring. And this was before the internet was nearly as widespread and before the games were so well-documented.
You find these birds in remote locations and catch them, and the dex calls them "legendary". So then you show them off to all of your friends at school and them become the coolest kid on the playground and everyone begs you to trade.

It's not an experience that can be recreated by any new game, because information is just too easily accessible. But the minimal information on legendaries back then made them actually feel legendary, even out of universe.

The ruination quartet are based, though.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52774636
>What went wrong?
Gen 1 and 2 Pokemon were designed so that they could be rendered in a 56x56 sprite on a tiny black and white screen and still be recognizable. That's why they're mostly simple shapes, that's why they're mostly based on animals and objects, that's why they have limited textures, colors and surface details.

As the technology advanced the designs became more complex and colorful. There are Pokemon now that would be impossible to accurately render under the restrictions of OG Gameboy hardware.

Your shadow ball it's always a 3hko, btw. I recommend testing both cases and seeing how often they stay (and for how many turns) and if the recovery is worth. I think it is, otherwise all you have is a mediocre Skelly check.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52784120
If you're looking for short stories/oneshots, a few ideas I had were
> Latias and Ash slip away for a quiet moment during the events of the first movie and Ash gets his first proper kiss
> Redux of the ending where Ash calls out to Latias and asks her if she wants to go (you can go either way on it)
> Ash thinks of Latias after his loss to Tobias
> Ash asks for Latias's help in the lead up to his Tobias match and we get Latias vs Latios
Anything beyond those will probably feel too OOC for Ash or Latias. He's not the person to realize he's in love and go find her.
As for *longer* stories, I want to see the "Latias joins Ash's party for a whole region" idea played straight just one time. Just one time invent a set of circumstances where he goes back for her or she finds him and they decide to take on a region together and maybe kiss a bunch. I'm very partial to that and am working on a *very* long-form version of that story, unfortunately without the kissing and also a lot more stuff piled in that'll probably turn off anyone looking for Ash and Latias to kiss.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52784274
Yeah having an extended story with Ash and Latias basically asks for one of two things. Either Ash has to stay with Latias or Ash has to go back for Latias. He would never do the former because he has his journey and his dream to follow and he really wouldn't do the latter because Ash doesn't look backwards, he barrels onwards forever in search of his dream. Journeys was basically the only time you could write in a reason for Ash and Latias to meet again, since it involves him randomly stumbling upon locations he's visited before.
Speaking as a writefag myself, it took me forever to come up with a reason Ash would go back for her, and it legitimately relied on another character begging him to take some time for himself after a string of nasty losses AND him randomly deciding on Alto Mare because he found the picture Latias gave him earlier in the story. He's never taken a vacation before in his life and only comes to a decision on that because I had to air drop a big neon sign reminding him of it.

>>52775814
To those asking about Special Delivery Bidoof. It's significantly more rare than the other two cards. That adds to its price. You had to opt in to special promotional emails and the text was buried within. Then you had to enter a lottery (which not everyone got selected -- like the charizard -- but even more exclusive), then you had to be picked. It was to commemorate the opening of the Canadian Pokemon center site.

On top of that, I heard rumors that TPCi actually RAN OUT of the bidoof cards. So if you placed an order near the end of the eligibility dates with your code, there was a chance that they actually ran out of cards. It's the rarest of the three and will likely be the most expensive.

Stop trying to deflect your inanity towards me, young man. The fact that you people can't understand the basic blocks of fictions should give pause to your statement. I don't find pleasure over this. in fact I've grown to find it even more icky than before. Realizing that Pokémon share the space of innocent natural creatures, to learn that their construction and attitudes mirror that of dogs and cats by choice and reading all these perverted posts is enough to give any decent person pause.

The issues isn't consent or that they're sexually active, the issue is that Pokémon don't occupy the space for it to be right. Pokémon are creatures that are treated like cats and dogs, that have the attitude of cats and dogs and are also creatures that occupy that space in-universe. They don't occupy the space of being people. These are creatures that eat dry food out of a dog bowl, that exhibit zoomies when excited and they also chew on shoes, these are creatures that simply want to be friends with you like a dog wants to be friends with a person. They're deliberately constructed to mirror creatures that are naturally affectionate towards humans in the real world and I bet many people can see that. It's a big part as to why Pokémon resonate strongly with people in the real world, despite being fantasy critters we can see how they reflect creatures from the real world. This becomes very apparent from reading the product guide from 2010 because TPC set guidelines up to safeguard this construction from 3rd parties.

In short Pokémon are not people, they're not human so we shouldn't impose anything on them. People here need to be honest with themselves and just admit they want to have these icky fantasies with critters that follow orders and are socially subordinate to their trainers who also have the mannerisms and thought process of dogs. No ones owes you to play into these delusions and mirages, let's be honest with ourselves without sugarcoating.

Pokémon act the way they do because they represent the critters that Tajiri interacted with as a child and also because he himself sees Pokémon as creatures that are like cats and dogs. Hey it's me again, stopping in to plug the VN I'm writing. Hang out with Cynthia in Olivine City and solve crimes! Guest appearance by Jasmine. Contains lewds. It's completely free.

https://writefuck.itch.io/olivinelights

>What's new?
I had intended Day 5/Friday to be a fairly brief epilogue to finish off the game, but it ended up more involved because of all the little things I wanted to tie up and the small variations on how the plot can play out. Day 5 is pretty much all written (including a second lewd scene with Cynthia!) but I need to finish editing/spellchecking the new scenes, clean up some lewd art, and then double check that there aren't any inescapable narrative dead ends that the game won't be able to proceed from. I'm sure I've missed something. There is also now a Day 6/Saturday but it's just one brief scene where you say goodbye and leave before the credits roll.

Anyway my goal it to have version 1.3 released on or before Christmas day. I think I'll make it?

>>52725067
>What is the planned final version
Oh man that's a hard question to answer definitively because I'm making this up as I go. I started writing in July, posted the first playable version in September, and intended to release monthly updates as I add things and fix bugs. The game will be "complete" as of 1.3 in the sense that the story is finished, but I have a ton of secrets and side paths that I want to add, as well as some alternate options for endings. For example right now you can go to Jasmine's computer and find some material to blackmail her with, but I haven't yet added in an option to actually blackmail her or the scenes that would follow that. So I don't really know when the game with be 100% complete.

I've also had a handful of ideas where I had to stop myself and ask if they actually fit in this VN or if they'd be better off for a sequel and/or their own story. I'm not trying to cram every little possible thing into this VN, just the things that fit with the story.

Not arguing Serena vs N because I don’t have N to compare anyways, but Serena’s debuffs are random so you’re not likely to actually debuff -5 SpDef in one turn. posts.com:
>>52760148
I've seen some theories that Geeta might be Nemona's sister. I thought it was dumb at first, but I've actually become delusional enough to start believing it.
In Japanese, Geeta speaks like a fancy rich lady, which would fit with Nemona's family being rich. Nemona is one of the only people who has anything good to say about Geeta, which could be due to them being related. Similarly, Nemona seems to want Geeta's approval despite having already beaten Geeta in battle, which makes more sense if she looks up to Geeta as more than just a trainer.
Geeta also says how she's not used to seeing Nemona be so excited, which implies she's known Nemona long enough to have an idea of how she normally acts. Also Geeta calling Nemona to let her know you became a champion makes a lot more sense if they're close enough to talk outside of official situations.
I just think it would be really cool if the DLC focuses on both Nemona and Geeta, leading up to them revealing that they're both related.

I don't think them being siblings would add much in the first place since they already have an interesting relationship and parallels in their writing. They're both isolated by their talent and passion and Geeta is envious of your relationship with Nemona and clearly wanted someone to clash and grow alongside herself. All they need is the screentime.
I wouldn't particularly mind if it ended up that way but I just don't see it. Nemona clearly knows who her sister is and it would be very weird for her to just not have brought up that it's Geeta the whole game.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52782147
As the final series? No, it wasn't a good way to go out. Ash didn't use any reserves, and not all of his companions got returns. On top of that, Ash's participation in the PWC and Master 8 was under baked and lacked the tension/intensity worthy of a tournament intended to crown the strongest trainer in the world.

Now I like Journeys... all of Ash's capture episodes were great, and I particularly loved his Gengar. I really like Goh a lot too, and the episodes that explore his backstory, as well as the ones with Scorbunny, are really good, and his dynamic with Ash is a high point of the series for me. The fillers are generally among my favorites in the anime's history. What brings Journeys down is that it tries to do way too much with way too little direction, all the while serving as a final series.

Journeys could've been one of, if not the best, series, if only it had been better planned out and the full support of OLM. Being a four year series as opposed to the shortest would've greatly helped, especially if the extra episodes went toward Ash's advancement (and setbacks) in the PWC, multi-part companion returns, additional PM focus and Goh character development, and lastly something for Koharu that actually ended up leading somewhere. Oh and more world tour stuff that focused on revisiting places Ash had been to as well as locations from the games that the anime ignored. I would've been over the moon had we gotten something like this.

>>52761880
That's awesome it got you into online competitive battles!
Here's my wholehearted suggestion as someone who finally got a damn grasp of what everything means back in Gen 6, play to have fun.
Focus on using favorites and build around them, try a number of team building styles to see which works best for you. Me personally I'm a fan of balanced and hyper offensive teams. I'd avoid worrying about numbers and entirely avoid meta picking. It's fine if a mon you like ends up being a meta mon, but there's truly nothing more soulless than an entire team of copy/paste meta sets.

Me personally I have used a number of my favorites, built teams around them, tried new pokemon I've never touched before, made new favorites, and have accomplished breaking numerous top 500 tiers to varying degrees in both single and doubles across 3 generations.

Pokemon is about having fun catching and using those pokemon for battle. The mechanics aren't that difficult to teach, and I'd honestly extend the offer to teach you myself if you want a personal better understanding.

Despite the valid dissenters and those that have never played pokemon competitively about showdown, it's an excellent resource in trying new things on a dime without much commitment, so you find out what DOES work to then commit to it in game, which by the way has been made a billion times easier this generation compared to ones prior, an absolute massive win in my opinion!

If you'd like to know an omega powerful set with Polteageist, have a mon that is capable of setting up psychic terrain, have it faint or switch in on a prediction that involves you not getting hit (it's risky), make sure your polteageist has weak armor, a focus sash, and shell smash with stored power, shadow ball and a fairy coverage move for dark types, and you will have a borderline unkillable sweeper, the likes only other sashed mon can deal with or a scarfed ditto.
The psychic terrain helps out massively because it blocks ALL priority moves so you won't get gibbed by a revenge killer.

I dunno if the thread will be up by the time I get back tomorrow, I was about to head to bed in like 30, if you have Discord and would like to learn more neat tips, mechanics and the like, let me know, I'd be more than happy to help out.

OP here, I have finished spreading Christmas cheer. Results were better than expected:
>Both male and female breeding leftovers of all three startermons (the 2nd to last Quaxly even has its HA)
>A few tasteful apricot breeding leftovers (many female)
>Some regional exclusives
>Some CHS and CHT Pokémon (I did not know that the game distinguishes between pokemon caught in Chinese Simplified and Chinese Traditional)
>One JPN Fletchling named やきとり ("Fried Chicken")

Overall, I'm pretty happy. The fact that no one was trading Paradox mons means that the ones I traded will be extra special to those who receive them; perhaps, for someone, my Iron Bundle is the first one they received on their cart. If I made someone's day, be they some kid, college student, working adult, or even another anon, then my efforts have paid off. Given how rare actually good Pokémon were in my trading experience, I have no doubt that all 90 recipients were at least pleasantly surprised by my ready-to-sweep Iron Bundles, if not ecstatic.

The only thing I was hoping in return for my efforts were one (1) of each startermon so that I could complete the dex, and I am most pleased to say that I got more of them than expected. The amount of charmanders floating around was surprising, though they're a welcome surprise too. I now have completed the pokedex on a mainline series game for the first time in twenty Christmases of playing Pokémon mainline games.

Merry Christmas, anons. I hope this thread entertained you too.

>Captcha: HP040

>>52781618
Not OP, but I think the most disappointing facet of the Johto starters is that they're not really that unique for an in-game playthrough. Typhlosion is Charizard with worse coverage, Meganium is Bulbasaur with Reflect/Lightscreen, but lacking Leech Seed other than an Egg move, and Feraligatr has high Attack but without a lot of good physical moves, and Johto has plenty of other water-type options.

Even if their designs are good, the fact that they don't have many interesting or unique options compared to other mons of the type simply make them less exciting by default. Chikorita is the only one where it seems like they tried for an interesting moveset, although using your starter as a support pokemon isn't exactly a concept with widespread appeal either.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Wasn't entirely sure on what rules to use for area encounters in Scarlet and Violet, but I saw that someone else used the Pokemon centers to split the Areas into smaller sections, so I went with that as well.
>Vs Katy
>Nymble
Nymble uses Struggle Bug, and Susanna strikes back with Aerial Ace. This repeats the next turn as well, with Nymble getting KO'd.
>Tarountula
Susanna hits Tarountula with Aerial Ace and gets hit with Bug Bite in return. Another Aerial Ace takes the spider out.
>Teddiursa-Tera
Susanna uses Silk Trap to slow Teddiursa down, blocking a Fury Cutter
Now faster than the bear, she hits it with Aerial Ace, and gets hit by Fury Cutter in return.
I don't want Fury Cutter to rise in power, so Silk Trap blocks the next strike.
Another Aerial Ace and Fury Cutter exchange leaves Susanna in the red, but with one final Aerial Ace, Teddiursa is defeated.

>>52717546
Starmie is really nasty, it has a +22.5% crit rate with Bubblebeam for an effective power of 65*1.5*1.8= 175bp off of 100 Special.

In RBY criticals don't do double damage, rather it's level dependent multiplier of (2*Lv+5)/(Lv+5). That means a Level 2 Rattata on Route 1 getting a critical only hits for 1.28 times damage.
I actually kind of like that, it makes the early game much less volatile, no one hit kills on an unlucky critical. And it's not like it affect competitive much since at 50 the multiplier is 1.9 and at 100 it's 1.95.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Hey friends, I've been wanting to relive the days when I actually enjoyed this fucking series, so I figured I'd do a Nuzlocke challenge like the good old days. Gonna play the era I enjoy, GBA/DS. Sort of a region-travel playthrough. FireRed, SoulSilver, Emerald, Platinum, and White.

Rules aside from the normal:
>Champion Clause: Any Pokemon, living or dead, that makes it to the HoF in one game has its line stricken from all subsequent ones. This includes split evos like Eevees or Hitmons.
>Set battle style
>Wild Pokemon and Starters randomized to within the same power level to make catches actually somewhat interesting in regions with poorly-distributed Regional Dexes

Starting off with a choice of Totodile, Pichu, or Ralts with Brock as my first gym leader makes things easy, though it does unfortunately give Boomer's rival, Zoomer, what he called "an easy dub no cap fr fr" with a two-shot Thundershock. Thankfully, I don't consider the Nuzlocke to start until after Rival 1, so here we go!

Time for Brassius. Decided to put Ember on YankeeDoodle again, Sudowoodo might take more from that than Flame Charge.

Platinum is pretty infamous for the number of surprise walls and run-killers it has. Be ready because the game

>>52778772
Johto is broadly based on the Kansai region of Japan, its cultural and historic center, which is reflected in the game's traditional and more explicitly Japanese aesthetic. This is as opposed to the modern and metropolitan Kanto region (named for its real-life equivalent Kantō, which is centered around Tokyo).
The concept of a region based around all of Japan never made it past this early stage as seen in the OP but at the very least it would have serious implications for the setting of Gen 3 and 4, which were based on the Japanese islands of Shikoku in the south and Hokkaido in the north.
